intro: Gnaphalium rugulosum, commonly known as the roughhead everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or white, arranged in dense clusters. Gnaphalium rugulosum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
